summary: The document is a compilation of telegrams, messages, and reports detailing the activities of Ivan Gavrilovich ALFERYEV, a suspected KGB officer, across various Latin American countries including Mexico City, Buenos Aires, and Lima. It outlines his assignments, movements, and interactions with other Soviet officials, alongside mentions of his family. The text also covers surveillance operations, intelligence gathering efforts, and counterintelligence activities targeting ALFERYEV and other Soviet diplomatic personnel. It includes operational summaries, deferred telegrams, and assessments, highlighting the focus on monitoring Soviet officials and their clandestine contacts.

ALFERYEV's family, including his wife Roza Alekseyevna ALFERYEVA and their son, is mentioned, along with their movements and activities.
The document references surveillance and joint audio operations targeting ALFERYEV during his time in Buenos Aires.
There is speculation about ALFERYEV's role as a KGB resident in various postings and his interactions with other known or suspected KGB officers.
The document includes deferred telegrams and actions related to intelligence gathering, indicating ongoing monitoring and assessment of ALFERYEV and other Soviet officials.
References to Soviet diplomatic personnel and their activities in various countries, including Argentina, Mexico, and Cuba.
